item.title: Forecasting: Getting Started
item.description: The Historical Roots of Forecasting Since the dawn of human civilization, the desire to predict the future has driven human curiosity and exploration. For instance, ancient Chinese practices such as BaZi, oracle bone divination, and lot-drawing, as well as Western methods like tarot reading, reflect humankind’s persistent fascination with forecasting. Across cultures, interpreting dreams to glimpse the future has been equally popular. In ancient China, the Taishi Bureau in the Song Dynasty used basic meteorological principles to forecast weather, aiding agricultural and other societal activities.
